## Acids

## Bases

<div class="bases d-flex flex-wrap justify-content-center gap-4">

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=naoh">
<img src="hidroxido de sodio.png" alt="Sodium hydroxide" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Sodium hydroxide:</strong> a strong base used in the manufacture of soap, paper, textiles, and industrial cleaning. The atoms are shown separately to emphasize the ionic, non-covalent bond.

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=NH4OH">
<img src="NH4OH.png" alt="Ammonium hydroxide" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Ammonium hydroxide:</strong> formed when ammonia dissolves in water. Used in cleaning products and fertilizers.

</div>

## Salts

<div class="sais d-flex flex-wrap justify-content-center gap-4">
